name: granny stitch half hexagon shawl
notes:
this granny stitch shawl uses the half hexagon shape, making it easy to style. it's crocheted from the top down with a simple one-row pattern repeat so you can adjust the size easily. this pattern is part of the [third edition of granny square month][1].

> **this pattern is available for free on my blog [here][2].**
> 
> the free version is supported by
> advertising on my website. the
> downloadable pdf for sale on ravelry
> includes the full pattern in one
> printable file without advertisements.

**skills used**
basic crochet stitches: chain, single crochet, double crochet, slip stitch
crocheting in rows, increasing
crocheting in chain spaces, changing colors (includes video tutorials)

**skill level**
easy

**finished size**
teen/adult: 49" (124.5 cm) wingspan x 20" (51 cm) spine.

**materials**
cascade yarns 220 superwash yarn (100% superwash wool, 3.5 oz/100 g, 220 yd/200 m) – 2 skeins in 885 in the navy (ca) and 1 skein each in 887 wasabi (cb), 346 daisy yellow (cc), and 871 white (cd), *or approximately 440 yd (400 m) in ca and 220 yd (200 m) each in cb, cc, and cd in any medium weight, wool yarn*. 

us size j-10/6 mm crochet hook, *or any size needed to obtain correct gauge.*

yarn needle.

**gauge**
16 sts (in 2 dc, ch-1 sp pattern) = 4” (10 cm) across with larger hook. *exact gauge is not critical for this pattern*.


  [1]: https://undergroundcrafter.com/2025/06/01/granny-square-month-is-back/
  [2]: https://undergroundcrafter.com/2025/06/13/granny-stitch-half-hexagon-shawl-crochet-pattern/
